intro: Paliurus spina-christi var. inermis, commonly known as the smooth spined Chinese thorny plant, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its thornless stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by small, fleshy berries that are edible for birds. It is often used in traditional Chinese medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its hardy nature and adaptability to various soil conditions.
